title_full:
Yuching Huang

              —
              The Crystal Hum
            
              (Night School)
label: Night School
description:
Beautifully eerie balladry and pop déjà entendu by Taiwan’s Yu Ching, in an uncannily familiar yet detached style of songwriting reminiscent of a Lynch dream sequence scored by Les Rallizes Denudes, overseen by Alex Zhang Hungtai, Cindy Lee and The Space Lady  

“The Crystal Hum is the debut vinyl release by Taiwan-based artist Yuching Huang and her first release for Night School. A beguiling dreamscape of crackles, spluttering, love-struck Casios presided over by the the spectral vocal... more

label: AD 93
description:
The Knife's Olof Dreijer (fka Oni Ayhun) continues his solo voyage with this sparkling three tracker, picking up where last year's 'Souvenir' and 'Rosa Rugosa' and marking out a balmy island between supple rhythmic melodicism and West Coast new age-inspired bliss.

Dreijer emerged from the shadows last year, ditching his mysterious Oni Ayhun pseudonym and finally working under his own name. 'Coral' is loosely inspired by 'Souvenir', his ingenious steel drum-led collaboration with Mt. Sims, but... more

label: Real Landscape
description:
Chthonic Glasgow figurehead Murray Collier (Grim Lusk) wears his charmingly shabby Dip Friso bonnet for a 5th release of textured downbeats including a superb Tirzah-esque turn with Still House Plants’ Jess HK amid more heathered mind-drift blooz and Wanda Group-like crankiness

Ushered under an eponymous title, ‘Dip Friso’ can be heard as the project’s definitive salvo after a couple of lowkey tapes and 2022’s excellent ‘Crocodile or Real?’, all via his Real Landscape label. The... more

release:
Annie U R A Bird 
            
              (Purely Physical Teeny Tapes)
title_full:
M. Quake

              —
              Annie U R A Bird (Ft Jonnine)
            
              (Purely Physical Teeny Tapes)
label: Ft Jonnine
description:
Delectable, mutant lovers rock dub flip of Annie Lennox by Naarm’s lowkey scene lynchpin Tarquin Manek starring the honeyed but ghostly vocal of HTRK’s Jonnine.

Adding to a carousel of aliases that have cropped up on these pages over the past decade - LST, Silzedrek, Static Cleaner Lost Reward, F Ingers, Tarcar - Tarquin Manek reprises the Martina Quake handle used on a 2020 concrète dub cover of Eartha Kitt for this brilliantly gritty new downstroke, delivered to cushion your... more

title_full:
Manuel Gonzales (MGUN)

              —
              Days Gone By
            
              (100 Limousines)
label: 100 Limousines
description:
Wheww! Proper sci-fi boogie skooled Detroit beatdown by the one and only MGUN on the 100 Limousines label, who previously served an AOTY of ’21 with Kemetrix’s debut album - pure crud for fans of the 313’s weirdest, slower strains cultivated and mutated by likes of NRSB-11, Shake, Urban Tribe, H-Fusion, Actress

As a solo producer of repute since his killer 2012 serves on TTT and Kyle Hall’s Wild Oats; as part of UR’s live act; and now with his own label Hold Me Recordings: Manual... more

label: Permanent Draft
description:
Proper curveball here from percussionist extraordinaire Valentina Magaletti (Moin, Vanishing Twin, Holy Tongue etc), who tracks her wildest deviations on 'Lucha Libre', exploring dungeon-strength technoid sound art, concrète dub, B-movie atmospherics and spannered post-punk, everything hitched to her rock-solid internal metronome. 

Look no further than 'NOIAZ' to get a handle on this one. Dense with chattering, oversampled voices, the track is hinged on a rolling beatbox whirr... more

label: sferic
description:
Muzzing the membranes between chamber music, contemporary dance, dark pop and ethereal ambience, Klein, Mica Levi and Space Afrika collaborator Bianca Scout distills a decade of multidisciplinary work at the service of her maziest, most enchanted album, moving between diaristic ephemera, demure post-punk and chamber ambient, and cracking open bewildering crypto-romantique wormholes in the process. 

A triple threat dancer/musician/performer, Bianca Scout has been a... more

title_full:
Demdike Stare x Dolo Percussion

              —
              DOLO DS
            
              (DDS)
label: DDS
description:
The DDS 12” series follows that blink-n-miss Shinichi Atobe opener with this full curveball from Demdike Stare, finding the UK x US brukbeat axis twisting wildstyle thru the deadly first shots of a Demdike x Dolo Percussion hookup that’s been years in the making, set to dominate dancefloors for the foreseeable.

Since 2019 Demdike Stare had been playing edits of Dolo Percussion’s bare-boned breaks in their DJ sets, eventually sharing them with Dolo’s Andrew Field-Pickering (Beautiful Swimmers... more

title_full:
Tutu Ta

              —
              The Shrine
            
              (Long Gone Records)
label: Long Gone Records

title_full:
Time Is Away

            —
            Turn On Arabic Radio Oscura (Knekelhuis)

label: Numbers
description:
FELT proprietor Fergus Jones - fka Perko - flits to Glasgow dons Numbers to convect his debut album of drowsy downbeat sentiments graced by cameos from Laila Sakini, Huerco S., James K, ELDON & Withdrawn, Lia T, and Koreless.

Since 2022, from a HQ in Copenhagen, Fergus Jones has launched a raft of goodness on FELT by everyone from Civilistjävel! to Carrier, Mother and Princess Diana of Wales, not to mention shelling acclaimed DJ sets around the globe ‘Ephemera’ now distills... more

label: N&J Blueberries
description:
HTRK’s N&J Blueberries label come with the first entry in what promises to be an occasional mixtape series culled from sets at their Psychic 9-5 club space, here inviting Perila to cast an hour-long spell subliming psychedelic ambience, spiritual jazz, wyrd environmental, industrial dream pop x rhythmic oddities into an eerie polychromatic haze.

As prolific as she’s been this last half decade - with releases for labels including Sferic, Smalltown Supersound, Shelter Press, and our own Documenting... more

label: Incienso
description:
Brian Leeds (Huerco S.) assumes his ultimate deep house and techno form as Loidis with an hour-long album of micro-dosed, dub wise delicacies on Incienso label - big RIYL Shinichi Atobe, NWAQ, DJ Sprinkles, Vainqueur.

Trading under an archaic name for Leeds, Loidis goes on like a long weekend in one of its infamous club or house parties, rolling out deep and long with eight hypnotically immersive cuts distinguished by his trippy surface detailing and heavily infectious grooves. After years... more

release: The Tumbling Psychic Joy of Now
title_full:
Holy Tongue meets Shackleton

              —
              The Tumbling Psychic Joy of Now
            
              (AD 93)
label: AD 93
description:
Holy Tongue's humid, ritualistic dubs are blotted into Rorschach shapes by Shackleton on this kaleidoscopic collaboration- one for fans of Creation Rebel's hypnotic 'Starship Africa' or Don Cherry's head-mangling 'Eternal Rhythm'.

Moments after releasing the ace 'Jinxed by Being' with US wyrd folk journeyman Six Organs of Admittance, Shackleton is back with another labyrinthine full-length, this time breaking bread with Valentina Magaletti, Al Wootton and Susumu Mukai, aka Holy... more

label: Hyperdub
description:
Arriving on Hyperdub for their first proper solo release in ages, Mica Levi delivers a 17 minute (12 on the digitals) orchestral dream pop epic, dispersing hallucinatory vocals buried in silvery clouds of strings and a motorik rhythm, somewhere in the vicinity of work by Dean Blunt and A.R. Kane, but ultimately just Mica’s thing.

There's a fantastical quality to Levi's music that's present even in their most stripped-to-the-bone productions, from 2017's DDS-released classic 'Delete Beach' to 2020's... more

label: ESCHO
description:
One of the definitive albums of 2024, edited and remixed by close pals and admirers; Conrad Pack, ML Buch, Blood Orange, Valentina Magaletti, Lolina, Smerz, Slauson Malone, HVAD and more.

The judicious pick of editors render the downbeat charms and quietly reflective, penetrating lyrics of ‘Great Doubt’ into spaces faithful to, adjacent, and far removed from Astrid Sonne’s beloved originals. Variously teasing its baked in ingredients of chamber music, art-pop, and R&B from curious new... more

label: TAL
description:
Düsseldorf-via-Paris maverick of drunken master groove, Detlef Weinrich aka Tolouse Low Trax - also part of Kreidler and salon des amateurs resident - does his hypnotic offbeat thing on Stefan Schneider’s increasingly fire TAL label.

Since fully committing to this solo sound at the turn of the 2010s, after years as a member of art dance band Kreidler, Tolouse Low Trax has become emblematic of a dare-to-differ swagger, also pursued by likes of pals and collaborators Lena Willikens and... more

label: Accidental Meetings
description:
Wickedly detuned and cruddy sorts of psycho death rock wallow and sputtering propulsion by Benjamin Rupp’s project, chasing the dragon to Accidental Meetings after turns on Stay Awake! and Opal Tapes.

‘Pop Music’ is B. Rupp’s crankily skewed definition of a tried and tested vein of punk indebted to Suicide and NYC no wave, and crossing contemporary lines with likes of early Powell, aspects of Silent Servant, and Oliver Ho’s Slow White Fall. He instantly snags with the sherm-huffing nasal... more

title_full:
Jabu

              —
              A Soft and Gatherable Star
            
              (do you have peace?)
label: do you have peace?
description:
Jabu take a big leap skyward on a gorgeous new album of hazed dreampop and burnished bass inspired by classic Cocteau Twins via A.R. Kane - essential listening for fans of HTRK, Rat Heart Ensemble, YL Hooi.

Launching with a dampened crash and slo-mo thuds, 'Oceanside Spider House' is the ideal re-introduction to the Bristol trio of Amos Childs, Alex Rendall and Jasmine Butt, who built a cult following for their blown-out, hypnagogic dub diffractions on 2017's 'Sleep Heavy' for Blackest... more

release: Compassion Crew Presents 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins'
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Compassion Crew Presents 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins'
            
              (Compassion Cuts Records)
label: Compassion Cuts Records
description:
Superb selections joining dots between gospel, noise, zouk, disco, soul, fast rap, psych-folk and UK techno, plotted by Dublin’s elusive Compassion Crew.

Nearly a decade since their debut venture, the deep diggers of Compassion Crew repeat the magic of 2016’s excellent ‘Compassion Cuts, Tapes & Acetates’ comp by pulling threads from myriad fringes into a storytelling tapestry of styles on 'Compassion Cuts, Sins & Dollar Bins’.

All legit licensed from source, it grabs hearts form the off with the... more

label: Somewhere Press
description:
Manifesting a soporific vision of classic dreampop, Man Rei lands on Glasgow’s Somewhere Press with one of the years most memorably hushed albums; unfolding through an hour of quietly soaring songs that split the difference between Enya, Seefeel and Grouper. Trust, it’s special stuff.

Kristin Reiman, aka Man Rei, elevates and expands the choral tradition of their Baltic homeland with the smudged drift of this quietly epic new album. A moody, dimly lit summoning of ambient music... more

title_full:
DJ Plead & rRoxymore

              —
              Read Round City EP
            
              (Smalltown Supersound)
label: Smalltown Supersound
description:
DJ Plead and rRoxymore with a sick debut collab of rhythmelodically restless productions, infusing limber, freewheeling styles with subtly psychedelic balearic melodics - a big one for followers of CCL, Batu, Nick León, Olof Dreijer, Joe, Nídia & Valentina Magaletti.

After meeting for the first time in 2019, Hermione Frank and Jarred Beeler got together at Frank's Berlin studio, slowly sculpting fractal geometries before finally adding the finishing spit and polish at Beeler's parents’ house in Sydney... more

title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Deep Entries : Gay Electronic Excursions 1980-1985
            
              (Dark Entries Records)
label: Dark Entries Records
description:
Highest grade Gay disco and electronic curios dug from Dark Entries’ special shelf, spanning lesser known jewels by staples such as Boytronic, Patrick Cowley & Paul Parker, and Nightmoves, plus a superb haul of obscurities ranging from Maxx Mann’s tart sauce, the sparky canter of Muzak, Derrick Higgins’ darkwave chemsex soundtrack slathered in synth spunk, and the end-of-night sleaze of Bachelor’s Anonymous.

“Dark Entries has raided the bathhouse to bring us Deep Entries: Gay... more

label: Somewhere Press
description:
Glasgow’s excellent Somewhere Press return with their inaugural vinyl release, the debut album proper from Madelyn Byrd aka Slowfoam. Mining the seam between ecology and technology, Byrd offsets syrupy, dissociated electronics with sparse acoustic instrumentation and expressive field recordings, landing somewhere between Ulla, Marja Ahti and Andrew Pekler’s virtual exotica.

The polyrhythmic pulse of the natural world surges through Byrd’s productions, and though the sounds are... more

title_full:
Lemmi Ash / Sonic Weapon / KOOLMFL

              —
              & ...
            
              (Thinner Groove)
label: Thinner Groove
description:
Powder’s Japan-based Thinner Groove usher low-key minimal house and techno club cuts by international pals

‘&’ marks five years of Thinner Groove(s) with a subtle escalation of late night/early morning energies diffused between the gently breaks-driven, deep ambient house of ‘Presence’ by Sweden’s Lemmi Ash duo of martinou and Sam Forsberg, thru the Matthew Herbert-esque clipped strut and swing of ‘atonbow’ from KOOLMFL - notably making their debut here - and the nuanced... more

label: Wisdom Teeth
description:
Facta & K-Lone’s Wisdom Teeth portray the label’s soft take on UK club music thru a refractive prism of ambient, footwork, UKG and electronica by Purelink, Airhead, Ramzi, Maya Q, Ehua, and many more

For the past decade Wisdom Teeth has ridden the wave of UK bassbin movements, variously hosting the vinyl debut of Aya as Loft, and frolicking the spaces of post-dubstep’s nuclear fallout. In recent years they’ve become standard bearers of a certain, warm and friendly club sound that... more

label: STROOM
description:
'Barbara' is the eagerly-awaited next deployment from Voice Actor, who drapes her soporific, dream-diary recitations over fittingly horizontal, dubbed-out reverberations from Welsh producer Squu. RIYL Mica Levi, Dean Blunt, Lolina or Rat Heart.

After astonishing us with the massive 'Sent from my Telephone', Noa Kurzweil returns with the next installment of the Voice Actor project, this time flanked by Squu, whose smoked-out tones you might have come across if you've been tuned into... more

label: wherethetimegoes
description:
Following up an acclaimed amphibious debut 'Frog Of Earth', Mel Keane fills an empty world with 'Airs', fermenting fragments of folk, sacred music and birdsong into pungent electro-acoustic daydreams. RIYL Atte Elias Kantonen or Oval.

Like its predecessor, 'Airs' is a demonstration of Dublin-based Keane's virtuosic sound design skills, but it's not showy. While 'Frog Of Earth' attempted to unravel the outside world from the perspective of an amphibian, 'Airs' imagines an open, untouched... more

title_full:
Vegyn and John Glacier

              —
              A Dream Goes On Forever
            
              (PLZ Make It Ruins)
label: PLZ Make It Ruins
description:
One of London’s most promising producers, Vegyn links the city’s rising stars, John Glacier and Lauren Auder, on the bittersweet triumph of a preparatory EP for incoming album, ‘The Road to Hell is Paved with Good Intentions’ - RIYL Bullion, Sampha, Frank Ocean

As proprietor and executive producer at his label, PLZ Make it Ruins - and also producer to Frank Ocean (‘Blonde’ and ‘Endless’) and Dean Blunt - Vegyn has been lowkey instrumental in shaping and intermingling alt.pop and... more

title_full:
James Massiah meets Lord Tusk

              —
              Open Up
            
              (Accidental Meetings)
label: Accidental Meetings
description:
Babyfather’s DJ Escrow, aka James Massiah, makes strong moves with Lord Tusk on a follow-up to his standout 12” ‘True Romance’ that lit up our summer 2024.

Delivered by one of the UK’s definitive gig and party programmers and labels, Accidental Meetings, the ‘Open Up’ 7" finds Massiah chatting on a late nite London special from Lord Tusk, marking up only his 2nd solo production credit, proper, of this year.

Crystalline cosmic pads, depth charge subs and ruggedest drums propel... more

label: 12th Isle
description:
12th Isle’s first of 2024 is an all-killer-no-filler comp playing to the strengths of the label’s tastes and programming tekkerz, spanning Glaswegian dub zingers, pitching disco, mutant pop and kosmiche dervish 

Revisiting the compilation format after 2019’s ‘Inkosi’ set, 12th Isle continue to skew dance music their own way with a bevy of regulars and noobs from all corners of the club map. It begins close to home with Murray Collier (Dip Friso) & Hannan Jones’ extended mix of the soundsystem... more

release: The Butterfly Drinks the Tears of the Tortoise
title_full:
CS + Kreme

              —
              The Butterfly Drinks the Tears of the Tortoise
            
              (The Trilogy Tapes)
label: The Trilogy Tapes
description:
Firm faves of the Naarm new skool, CS + Kreme, catch a fresh breeze of lysergic psych-folk and wistful eleectronics on a gorgeous 3rd album - the best format to fully indulge the duo’s mind-drift wanderlust. A must check RIYL Coil, Cyclobe, László Hortobágyi, Kakuhan, HTRK/Jonnine Standish, Pelican Daughters.

Since their self-titled 2017 debut for Total Stasis (which seriously needs a reissue!), CS + Kreme have been the most reliable soundtrackers of downtimes with a style that has... more

label: DDS
description:
International man of dub techno mystery, Shinichi Atobe returns to DDS with a new double album of pensile steppers and lip-smacking, feathered swang, a good 10 years since first crossing paths with Demdike Stare’s label - a massive RIYL for any heads into DJ Sprinkles, Red Planet, Mike Huckaby, Sususmu Yokota, Convextion, NWAQ.

For years people were convinced that Atobe was a well known artist (probably German) working incognito. Thanks to a flowery twitter feed, plus some interviews... more

label: Príncipe
description:
Príncipe outliers Niagara slosh across the grid on a 76 minute tape of free-flowing deep, acidic house and offbeat, organismic techno marinaded in briny Drexciyan synth substance and a sort of worming, villalobos-y ecstasy.

As with the trio’s previous pair of LPs, the cassette format proves an ideal canvas to showcase Niagara’s peculiar sound in long form. Through seamless but asymmetric transitions that run like a mixtape, they stitch myriad productions with a knotty intuition best to represent... more

release: Kicking Dust : The Goa Way, A Full Circle Compilation
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Kicking Dust : The Goa Way, A Full Circle Compilation
            
              (Full Circle Released)
label: Full Circle Released
description:
French duo Full Circle offer a corrective anthology here, celebrating the roots of psychedelic dance music and its early days in Goa with a slew of sludgy, industrial-tinged new beat, EBM, early techno and proto-house chuggers prioritized by some of the late '80s/early '90s most important selectors. With tracks from Cabaret Voltaire, Front Line Assembly, Clock DVA and Van Belle, it's crucial listening for anyone on Vladimir Ivkovic x Ivan Smagghe axis.

Long maligned by "serious" heads more drawn... more

label: LATENCY
description:
Príncipe’s MVP meets preeminent polymath Valentina Magaletti at 100% slay levels on their debut collaboration - a swingeing, rudely disciplined dervish of machine made and hand-played kudurhythmelody, firmed up with additional production from Tom Halstead (Moin/Raime).

‘Estradas’ is a stunning consolidation of distinctive musical vernaculars developed by Afro-Portuguese dynamo, Nídia, and tempestuous spar, Valentina Magaletti. Stitched together in post production by the latter’s... more

title_full:
Various

              —
              Venus Rising From The Sea
            
              (Doyenne)
label: Doyenne
description: Yeah a bit special this one, commissioned and curated by Flora Yin Wong for her label and publishing house Doyenne, ‘Venus Rising From The Sea’ is a collection of love-themed cover versions featuring Teresa Winter, Susu Laroche, Alex Zhang Hungtai, aya, Maria Minerva, Christina Vantzou, Spivak, Salamanda, clare rousay, Wild Terrier Orchestra, Dania and Flora Yin Wong herself covering songs by The Cure, Robert Wyatt, Mariah Carey, The Cranberries, Pentangle, The Carter Family... more

label: Efficient Space
description:
DIY pop hounds will be in their element with Amelia Besseny, Cooper Bowman and Yuta Matsumura’s 2nd album as Th Blisks - a big RIYL Altered States Tapes, Troth, Saint Etienne, Low Company types, Teresa Winter, Flaming Tunes, YL Hooi, sun-dazed Aussie songcraft.

A lo-fi Aussie dream-pop supergroup of sorts, Th Blisks only have one previous cult LP, 2022’s ‘How So?’, to their name, but draw on lifetimes embedded in local (but internationally renowned) scenes for a reliably hypnagogic pop... more

label: Peak Oil
description:
Leftfield jazz-fusion standard bearers Max D (Dolo Percussion) & Matt Papich (Co La) chase their PAN sides and ones for the former’s Future Times with more of that special sauce on their debut for Peak Oil.

Feauring guest input by Jordan GCZ and Motion Graphics blended in their own disjointed timelines and dislocated geographies using CDJs-as-instruments and steering wheels for polymetric navigation, Max & Matt follow from the more crisply defined geometries of previous into more... more

label: Tanum Records
description:
Heavy percussive flex from Winsome on his first record since 2017 ,out on Klaus' Tanum Records imprint.

"Who’s that finally wrestling tanum from the tyranical clutches of klaus? It’s winsome.

Coming in from the wilderness to deliver his first record since 2017, stepping off the path he’s been trodding through lovers rock to explore new territories of rhythm, sound and sub bass pressure."

            more

label: Relaxin Records
description:
Playing bass and singing capriciously over a sequence of sample-heavy productions, London's enigmatic great area muddles trip-hop, psychedelia and ferric C86 pop on 'light decline', released via Lolina's Relaxin label and tipped if yr into Broadcast, Sarah Records, Hydroplane, HTRK or Carla Dal Forno.

We were charmed by last year's elegant and brief 'Follow Your Nature', and 'light decline' - again issued via Lolina's label- sails into the same cool waters. There's still no hint at who great area... more

label: Versatile Records
description:
Low Jack, Iueke, Zaltan and Lippie lather louche mutations of art-pop-dub and avant-psych-folk in the wickedly ruffcut, downbeat blatz of Fracatso’s debut for Gilb’R and co’s Versatile - big tip to the Ssabae crew!

Born of spontaneous, slow burn combustions during a weekend at Lippie’s gaff in Lyon, Fracatso’s supergroup of sorts pair all manner of acoustic and electronic gear with an intimate, unpredictable appeal that speaks to their spirit of conviviality and genre-agnostic exploration. A certain... more

title_full:
V/Z

              —
              It's Cold in Baltimore
            
              (Offen Music)
label: Offen Music
description:
Valentina Magaletti & Susumu “Zongamin” Mukai, aka V/Z, serve a class new beat tape of icy, lo-slung no wave curveballs for Vladimir Ivkovic’s unpredictable Offen Music, knit with errant radio interceptions, looped strings and oodles of atmosphere on a tip somewhere between Bourbonese Qualk, Kim Gordon's 'The Collective' and Burial’s ‘Bird’ score.

Chasing shellings as members of Vanishing Twin and Holy Tongue, not to mention copious amounts of solo bullets, the finely tuned... more
